column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: INPUT_MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers

column.name: TRX_SEQ_NO
column.comment: An Oracle sequence that uniquely identifies the record.

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: REQ_SEQ_NO
column.comment: An Oracle sequence that uniquely identifies the porting request. This number is kept throughout the life-time of a request, and maintains the connection between the request stages.

column.name: TO_BE_PROCCESSED
column.comment: An indication for the various batch jobs involved in the Importing or Outporting process (i.e. PoDiMo in/out jobs,  internal importing approval job), specifying whether the record should be sent to PoDiMo/processed by the approval job.

column.name: REQ_TYPE
column.comment: The type of the porting request.

column.name: ORIG_MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market_code aus KIAS. MMC= Vodafone Credit,  MMO = Vodafone Callya , PUC = Service Provider Credit, PUA = Service Provider Debit

column.name: INPUT_BAN
column.comment: Indication of the customer's billing account number. The customer is the (natural or legal) person to whom services are provided on the basis of a contract concluded with D2-Vodafone. For himself or others to him

column.name: MSISDN
column.comment: Phone number

column.name: DONOR_NETWORK_PROVIDER
column.comment: Donor Network Provider.

column.name: RECIPIENT_NETWORK_PROVIDER
column.comment: Recipient Network Operator

column.name: DONOR_SP
column.comment: Donor Service Provider.

column.name: RECIPIENT_SP
column.comment: Recipient Service Provider.

column.name: DONOR_ACC_NUMBER
column.comment: The account number of the donor SP (for in-porting).

column.name: D2_ORDER_ID
column.comment: D2-activate order ID. This field will be NULL for requests coming from other sources.

column.name: STATUS_CODE
column.comment: Status Code

column.name: STATUS_DATE
column.comment: The date of the transaction status.

column.name: STATUS_FLAG
column.comment: Status flag for the respective status

column.name: NUM_OF_LOOPS
column.comment: Number of Loops. The number of times a request was temporarily rejected by PoDiMo.

column.name: BRAKETING_SEQ
column.comment: Grouping requests according to bracketing functionality.

column.name: SIM_SIZE
column.comment: The SIM card size.

column.name: TWIN_CARD_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the SIM card is a Twin Card. Valid values are Y - Yes and N - No A twin SIM card is composed of two physical SIM cards. Both from the network perspective and the inventory perspective the existence of two physical cards is transparent.

column.name: DUO_IND
column.comment: S - Duo Slave, M - Duo Master, N - Not Duo, M - Master, S - Slave

column.name: MSISDN_DUO
column.comment: The master/salve telephone number.

column.name: MSISDN_TYPE
column.comment: Typ der Rufnummer (M-Main/F-Fax/D-Data)

column.name: SECONDARY_MSISDN
column.comment: The number assigned to the secondary service.

column.name: PORTING_ORDER_DATE
column.comment: The date when the porting request was entered into KIAS2000.

column.name: COMMIT_END_DATE
column.comment: Specifies the date until which the customers commitment to the company is valid. If the customer terminates the commitment before it has ended, the customer pays an early termination penalty.

column.name: CANCELLATION_DATE
column.comment: The date on which the invoice was cancelled.

column.name: PORTING_DATE
column.comment: Porting date.

column.name: ERROR_CODE
column.comment: Holds the error / information code that returned by the inporting PoDiMo in job or code sent to Podimo by Outporting PoDiMo out job

column.name: ADR_TYPE
column.comment: Contains the Address type. This can be: R- General, P - P.O. Box, E - E-Mail

column.name: D2_MSISDN
column.comment: The new MSISDN, if the subscriber accepted the new contract offer.

column.name: DONOR_MARKET
column.comment: Name of the donor market . This field is updated by service during porting approval

column.name: ALLREADY_CANCEL_IND
column.comment: This indicator is used in the activation process to send cancellation information to switch  if needed.

column.name: PODIMO_ID
column.comment: Transaction ID generated by PoDiMo.

column.name: WAIVE_FEE_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether porting fee is waived.

column.name: FU_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether followup is required.  The flag is set by PodiMo for in-porting request that is final rejected.

column.name: BRACKETING_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether there is a bracketing or not.

column.name: DEALER_CODE
column.comment: Dealer code.

column.name: MANUAL_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether there was a manual handling via MNP History query.

column.name: WAIVE_LTR
column.comment: Indicates that all letters sent to this dealer should be waived. - Indicates whether the Cancel porting request letter is waived.

column.name: LONG_NAME
column.comment: Indicates to PoDiMo Out for  inporting whether it is necessary to concatenate the two name lines. - Indicates to PoDiMo Out for the inporting whether it is necessary to concatenate the two name lines.

column.name: ORIGINAL_MSISDN
column.comment: The original MSISDN. - The original MSISDN if MSISDN correction was performed

column.name: PREV_MSISDN
column.comment: Contains the previous Subscriber number that is changed to the current Subscriber number. - The previous MSISDN if MSISDN correction was performed.

column.name: NEW_MSISDN
column.comment: New phone number.The new MSISDN of the subscriber (if applicable). - The new MSISDN if MSISDN correction was performed.

column.name: RESPONSE_TEXT
column.comment: Response text received from PoDiMo

column.name: BP_SUBSCRIBER
column.comment: Belated Porting subscriber, receiving ported number as a result of Change MSISDN

column.name: CUSTOMER_TYPE
column.comment: Business customer identification; e.g. CA - Corporate Account, ME - Medium Enterprises, SE - Small Enterprises, SO - Small Office/Home Office , PC - Private Customer

column.name: LAST_NAME
column.comment: Contains the first part of the surname or company name.

column.name: FIRST_NAME
column.comment: First name of the customer / participant

column.name: BIRTH_DATE
column.comment: Date of birth

column.name: COMPANY_NAME
column.comment: The description of the company.

column.name: SIM_TYPE
column.comment: The code of the SIM type.

column.name: LOGO_CTG
column.comment: Indicator for ultracard usage

column.name: DESIRED_DATE_TYPE
column.comment: The desired way of porting (ASAP, Wished Date, Contract End Date), valid values 'C', 'W', 'A'

column.name: DESIRED_DATE
column.comment: This field is populated in case DESIRED_DATE_TYPE is 'W' and represents the Wised Date of Inporting.

column.name: SERVICE_ASSURANCE_IND
column.comment: When set, indicates for Outporting scenario that the MSISDN of the customer will not be cancelled if the porting date have to be moved on service assurance day. The MSISDN will be cancelled on the new porting date instead.

column.name: OPT_IN_IND
column.comment: The Opt-In indicator will be set to 'Y', if during creation of the SIT status, the subscribers Opt-In was (still) valid.

column.name: MATCHING_FLAG
column.comment: Flag to store the result (or state) of the porting order data matching process. Valid Values 'M' - Matched, 'N' Not Matched, 'I' - Initial, 'E' - Error.
